sense.def:
A sign
je znamenje ali lik s posebnim pomenom, na primer v matematiki ali glasbi.

A sign
je gib roke ali glave s konkretnim pomenom.

seg.quote: Through signs she communicated that she wanted the women to hide.

sense.def:
A sign
je tudi kos lesa, kovine ali plastike, na katerem so besede ali slike, ki posredujejo podatke ali navodila.

seg.quote: The exit sign is marked with an arrow.
A sign saying ‘Women's Centre’ hung over the door.

sense.def:
A sign of something
je dokaz, da tisto obstaja.

seg.quote: How pleasant to see a sign of summer once again.
The Englishman showed no signs of his annoyance.
His sores had begun to show signs of healing.

sense.def:
To sign a document
pomeni napisati svoje ime na dokument.

seg.quote: Sign your name in the book.

sense.def:
To sign something away
pomeni podpisati uradne dokumente, s katerimi potrjujemo, da nimamo več pravice do nečesa.

seg.quote: Chiefs were encouraged to sign away land that appeared to be unoccupied.

sense.def:
To sign for something
pomeni s podpisom obrazca uradno potrditi, da smo nekaj dobili ali sprejeli.

seg.quote: When signing for any parcel, always add ‘not inspected’.

sense.def:
To sign in
pomeni podpisati se v knjigo gostov v hotelu ali klubu in tako potrditi svoj prihod.

seg.quote: They signed in at the reception desk.

sense.def:
To sign on for a job or course
ali
to sign up for a job or course
pomeni uradno sprejeti delovno mesto ali se prijaviti za študij ali tečaj in o tem podpisati pogodbo.

seg.quote: He signed on the next morning with the RAF.
You could sign on for a course in word processing.
He signed up as a painter on the Federal Art Project.

sense.def:
To sign on
pomeni uradno izjaviti, da smo nezaposleni, tako da od države dobivamo denarno podporo;

To sign out
pomeni s podpisom v knjigi gostov uradno potrditi, da odhajamo iz hotela ali kluba.
